WorkItem.Description:
I used the armor Optimizer on on my priest and got an upgrade list...  I was curious so I looked at the upgrade list. It had only leather items listed and all the equip had agi or AP on it.  The staves listed were also melee only styled(no caster stats).
 
So I went to Refine types of items listed.  The only option available to check and uncheck were Leather, Staff, Polearm, 2H Mace, Relic, and Misc.  Everything else was grayed out and unselectable.  Upon further inspection, I found the Option tab reflects what it would for a Druid. (please note I loaded a Priest)
 
I loaded my character via Character Profile.  BloodElf / Priest. Initial it was set to Shadow but I changed it to Holy ( was going to try out the new feature but its not available).  I then used the Optimize option and received an Upgrade list (with only kitty items on it).  I checked the Comparison chart, it also only listed kitty items.  And none of my gear was changed to reflect the best gear for a holy priest (Consider I do have 2 sets of gear and I was wear the dps set)
 
 
 
Summary:
WorkItem.Summary: [Optimizer] Optimizer loads an Upgrade list and doesnt change gear

Comments.Message: Sounds like you were in the Cat model, not the S/Hpriest model. Make sure you have the correct class and model selected.

I was in Holy Model when i ran the optimizer, the optimizer kicked me into cat model.  (there is no option for me select cat model once I load my priest) I did find a solution to seeing the druid based gear.  Change my model again.  But correct me if I'm wrong; Rawr shouldn't be changing my model just because I run the Optimizer.
No, the Optimizer shouldn't change your model at all. Can you reproduce this? If so, please attach the character file and steps to reproduce it.
(Or if it only happens after loading from character profiler, please attach the CharacterProfiler.lua)
